item.title: Graffiti on front entrance of building, 12th November
item.description:
Graffiti vandalism on front entrance beside bus stop. This is becoming a worsening problem in the area with repeated tagging. I am concerned about the targeting of this location and would kindly request removal as well as installation of CCTV cameras to deter further vandalism.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 336, East Street, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No safeguards - Substandard slack job by Leaf Blowers this morning - Slippery Hazard for elderly and children, 12th November
item.description:
Leaf Blowers came with their vacuum this morning to clear part of the road leaving behind most of the leaves and debris on both the road and pavement (that serves as a pathway). if anything there are more leaves blown into residents way to slip on, that were originally inside the kerb, with the rain, the leaves are incredibly slippery and are a serious hazard for the elderly and disabled residents. When residents tried to flag the pavements to one of the council workers he assured residents that they would be back, no sight of them, slack 5 minute job if that, where they really couldn't even be bothered to move the bins, or vacuum up what was in front of them. Shame they did a fantastic job last year, this year the photos speak for themselves.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Walcorde Avenue, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement stones irregular. I had a bad fall., 12th November
item.description:
Outside the gate to No. 29, there is a steep difference between 2 paving stones, where I fell, but all that side of the road is irregular, and opposite Nos 100 to 118, as well. I am now attending the Falls Exercise Clinic at The Hornsey Health Centre, because of the falls. The pavement stones need re-laying, even and flat.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 13, Barrington Road, Crouch End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unofficial no parking cones, 12th November
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dulwich Wood Avenue, London

item.title: A large container, 12th November
item.description:
A large silver container has been dumped on Manor Road, we can see this from our back window. It is a rubbish collection style. It is most probably blocking the road and this can be very busy with Lorries, cars and vans all day. It has been there for 3 days
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ray Lamb Way, Slade Green, London
